HOW TO USE

This is an application of Bangla (2nd most popular Indic script) Handwriting Recognition. Its maiden (beta) version is uploaded for its distribution among Android (tested for Honeycomb only) Tab users. This application may be conveniently used for sending email or SMS in Bangla by writing the content using finger tip on the touch screen of the device. This application is user adaptive in the sense that during initial use by a new user, frequent errors are expected and the recognitiomn error should decrease fast with the entering of corrections during its repeated use. Before you start to use this application, please read the following instructions carefully.

  • You must draw one character (single or multiple strokes) at a time (e.g ক) including its matra (headline), if the authors is used to give such matra during handwriting.

  • Initially, the color of the drawing is yellow and it turns red after a while. The user should wait until the drawn symbol changes its color. After the above color change, the author should look at the white text area placed at the top of the screen. If the character is wrongly recognized, then the "Correct" button should be used for necessary modification.


Correction

If the app fails to recognise the input character correctly, the user should press the "Correct" button to select the corresponding correct character. On pressing the correct button, a table of possible characters appears from which the user should select the correct character. The vowel modifiers are associated with the character ক so as to display them(vowel modifiers unicode need to be combined with other values to be displayed).

If however the character is not recognised as any valid character the program will automatically display the correction dialog for the user.

Space button
For giving spaces in the text area

Backspace button
for giving backspaces in the text area

SMS/EMAIL
This button is used to forward the text as either sms or email

Combine
The present Beta version does not allow the writer to input a compound Bangla character (ক্ত) directly. Instead the writer should write the two concerned characters consecutively (such as কত for the above example ক্ত) and then press the combine button to combine the two letters forming the shape of the concerned compound character(JUKTAKHOR). Depending on the unicode support of the OS, sometimes rendering problem might occur failing to display the compound character properly. However, the receipient of the message will see it correctly.
